nominal.translation[0].definitions[0].de: officially described as being something, when this is not really true
nominal.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: the nominal head of the rebellion
Their conversion to Christianity was only nominal.
nominal.translation[0].definitions[1].de: relating to nouns or used as a noun
nominal.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: the nominal use of the present participle
nominal.translation[1].definitions[0].de: someone who has the title of head, leader etc but does not have the normal responsibilities, powers etc of that job
nominal.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Although he remained the nominal head of the campaign, his deputy took over responsibility for it.
nominal.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a nominal sum of money is very small, compared to the usual amount that would be paid or charged for something
nominal.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: He charges a nominal amount for his software, enough to cover expenses.
nominal.translation[1].definitions[2].de: a nominal figure, level etc is not the real one because something such as inflation has not been taken into account
nominal.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: While the Fed can peg the nominal federal funds rate, it cannot control the real rate (i.e. the nominal rate minus the rate of inflation).
